column4: ok i have a ubuntu hdd that i have put into a newly bought comp.  i booted from the ubuntu disk, and now it wont connect to the internet.
does anyone know what could be causing this problem?
its a desktop, and its on a wire. connected straight to router
ive had this issue before. but i forgot how i fixed it
you could try sudo ifconfig eth0 down and then sudo ifconfig eth0 up in terminal. Sometimes that will reload the connection and pull an IP
ive made it as far as ifconfig eth0 saying that i am connected.
let me try this
still not connecting
last time, i did some type of manual routing, which i have tried this time to the best of my knowledge
when you type ifconfig does it show an IP?
it will not show unless i manually set the DCHP reservation on the router for 192.168.1.107 and then set that ip as my box, but it still wont go online
okay one sec
it now shows inet addr: 192.168.1.107, but its not online, cannot connect to google.com
okay try this in terminal. Ping 74.125.225.111. And see what it says.
host unreachable
okay
when you type ifconfig you have a inet addr: right?
just to be clear, the gateway is my routers ip right?
yes
thats right, but i only have that because i have manually set it.
it says im connected, but really im not...
